newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Coda Music cut to hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Coda Music cut to hold.

text.p: --John G. Kinnard & Co said Wednesday it cut its rating for Coda Music Technology Inc to hold from buy, due to disappointing sales in some of its music education software in the third quarter.

--The company said third quarter sales of its Vivace Intelligent Accompaniment product were about $500,000 in the quarter, compared to $328,000 a year ago. Overall sales were $1.2 million, down from $1.4 million a year ago, Coda had said.

--"Relative to expectations, it was kind of a disappointment," Kinnard analyst Clinton Morrison said in a telephone interview. He noted that third quarter is usually the key selling time for educational products.
--"There's a chance that they may be making a pickup in the December quarter, but they may have missed the proverbial season," Morrison said.
--Coda's stock fell 15/16 to 3 on Nasdaq Wednesday.
